Because it is not how an ampersand works.

replies.author: TobiGr

replies.bodyText:
@opusforlife2
If you look at what the categories are in "Settings" for Android, it will say "and", not "&", between shared categories. Much like it says "and" for mentioning anything above one thing in NewPipe already.
If needing to specifically make it two distinct things,
"Option1, option 2" instead of
"Option1 option 2" is the way to go.
It makes it into languages where it doesn't belong at all
https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/newpipe/strings/nb_NO/?checksum=35c864b620356a41 https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/newpipe/strings/nb_NO/?checksum=b402d2ded65c5cd6 https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/newpipe/strings/nb_NO/?checksum=8260572532e87eb2
